greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Row sums of the Beta triangle A160480.
comment: It is conjectured that the row sums of the Beta triangle depend on three different sequences. Two Maple algorithms are given. The first one gives the row sums according to the Beta triangle A160480 and the second one gives the row sums according to our conjecture.
link: CP Herzog, KW Huang, K Jensen, Universal Entanglement and Boundary Geometry in Conformal Field Theory, arXiv preprint arXiv:1510.00021, 2015
formula: Conjecture: a(n) = (2*n-3)! - 2^(2*n-3)*(n-1)!*(n-2)!, for n >= 2 (gives the first 13 terms). - _Christopher P. Herzog_, Nov 25 2014
Meijer's and Herzog's conjectures can also be written as: a(n) = -A129890(n-2)*A000165(n-2) = A009445(n-2) - A002474(n-2). - _Peter Luschny_, Dec 01 2014
maple: nmax := 14; mmax := nmax: for n from 1 to nmax do BETA(n, n) := 0 end do: m := 1: for n from m+1 to nmax do BETA(n,m) := (2*n-3)^2*BETA(n-1, m)-(2*n-4)! od: for m from 2 to mmax do for n from m+1 to nmax do BETA(n, m) := (2*n-3)^2*BETA(n-1, m) - BETA(n-1, m-1) od: od: for n from 2 to nmax do s1(n) := 0: for m from 1 to n-1 do s1(n) := s1(n) + BETA(n, m) od: od: seq(s1(n), n=2..nmax);

nmax := nmax; A120778 := proc(n): numer(sum(binomial(2*k1, k1)/(k1+1) / 4^k1, k1=0..n)) end proc: A000165 := proc(n): 2^n*n! end proc: A049606 := proc(n): denom(2^n/n!) end proc: for n from 2 to nmax do s2(n) := (-1)*A120778(n-2)*A000165(n-2)*A049606(n-1) end do: seq(s2(n), n=2..nmax);
xref: Row sum factors A120778, A000165 and A049606.
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, May 24 2009, Sep 19 2012
